adrFormatAddress: 159 E 30th St APT 12A, New York, NY 10016, USA

originalText.text: Jon really made this test easier for me. He was able to make the test more simple to understand and slow it down for me to know what specific words and details to look out for. I work full time and he was very flexible in when and how to meet with me for our lessons and was very organized in putting me in a schedule and keeping me busy with home work to keep studying. Jon definitely bolstered my confidence for the LSAT and made me understand the test more entirely.

originalText.text: I took the February and April 2023 lsats after studying on my own and did not do well enough to get into school.  I found Jon after looking up LSAT tutors in NY. I wanted one on one time and my own schedule, because I had to take the June lsat and do well! I met with Jon for one month...2 to 3 times a week...focused and walked through problems and my score was raised 15 points within a month! He was so calm and patient and took his time explaining each problem.  He was able to pinpoint my weaknesses (reading comprehension!) and we walked through so many passages with tips and tricks.  We also did other LSAT sections too to strengthen areas I felt more confident in.  I am so happy I found him and chose him to tutor me.  We met through zoom just because it worked best logistically and honestly it was great.  He shares his whiteboard and puts up problems and you feel so at ease with the way he walks through problems.  I highly recommend him and am so thankful to him for getting me here...I entered law school fall 2023! How fast it all went! Thanks to him my application was able to be sent with a solid score.

originalText.text:
I work full time and needed a tutor who could be flexible with my schedule. Luckily, I found Jon, who was willing to tutor me on weekends over Zoom. I needed the most help with logic games. Jon gave me valuable tips/strategies and exposed me to the most unusual logic games so that I wasn't afraid on test day. I got the exact score I wanted and I was accepted to my school of choice.

His services are also much more affordable than tutors from the test prep companies.

Thanks Jon!

originalText.text: He was an amazing tutor. Very knowledgable and very organized; Always came with packets with similar themes of questions. Always friendly and on- time.  He would usually stay 5-10 minutes after the hour because I felt he truly cares about my progress. My first Diagnostic was a 137 but after doing 10 weeks with Jon im averaging a 160. Very positive experience for me. I would highly recommend if anyone locally is looking an LSAT Tutor.

originalText.text: I have tried other LSAT tutoring services, however Jon is the best I have ever had. Logical reasoning has always been the most difficult part of the exam for me, however, I have personally seen my score increase since using his time efficient and unique approaches in tackling certain question types broadly throughout the exam. Of all of the LSAT preparation resources I have used Jon provided the best value for the price. I would highly recommend Jon for anybody that wants to improve their score on the LSAT.
